title: The Good, The Bad, and the League: 12/27 - 1/2
body:
Our team wanted to be a bit more transparent around server issues, as well as other information that the NA playerbase may want to hear about. This is 100% a work in progress, so feedback around what’s here, or what you might want to see, is highly appreciated! 

Your weekly dose of server problem-os, NA League news, and other!

Happy New Year! More stuff that wasn’t really stuff but close enough happened this week. Neeko has some pinging bugs, still no bad server burps on NA, and some Your Shop offer issues, minor oops. 

_Also, much as you may want it to be true, this team doesn't deal with gameplay balance at all. _

**Follow-Follow-Ups:**

* Everyone hates Akali (Hate/Love relationship)
* But seriously, we’re not the balance team, so we can’t say anything around any future upcoming work she may or may not have

**Server Stuff: **

* Personalized Offers not available to some players (12/30, ~6 hours). Ran out of write space on a DB, causing offers to not populate properly. Increased DB space and increased cleanup task rate to ensure the DB wouldn’t run out of space again

* Personalized Offers incorrect and changing on players (12/31, ~19 hours). Regional promotion overwrote Your Shop, causing mismatched offers. Rewriting the regional offer with Your Shop fixed the issue, but affected players should still write in to Player Support

**Game Stuff: **

Nothing major to report

**Player Support Trend:**

If you did have Your Shop issues over the very end of December, it may be worth checking in with Player Support to ensure you didn’t lose out on anything!

Morgageddon & Couch Commando

Some of the best advice I can give, from the giving feedback to someone who is working on a product, is to always ask yourself two questions:

1) Is the feedback I'm giving clear?
2) Have I shut anyone out?

Long story short, think about how you want to engage, especially around hot topics.

For instance, here's two ways to approach feedback from a recent topic on Reddit today around damage

1: "League sucks, everyone bursts everyone down instantly, this is stupid and I hate it."
2: League currently has a lot of burst damage in the game (items, champs, recent reworks), which makes my preferred champ and playstyle of damage and positioning over time feel incredibly bad. Is this the future of League? Can we go back towards more drawn out fights that last longer than a few seconds? Are there any upcoming changes that may make the immediate future less explodey-bursty? 

Both say what they don't like currently (the burst in game). However, the first basically says 'This thing sucks, fix it' and the second goes 'this thing sucks to me because [reason], what, if anything, can be done about it?'

The second also opens up multiple avenues to talk around it, upcoming Pre-Season/New Season, changes to items, etc. The first just kinda hard dunks down 'X sucks, fix it'

TL;DR, 

Express feedback in a 'X thing feels like Y because it makes Z.' Then ask questions. Feelings are important, just don't let them be the only thing you're saying.

So the team on the boards isn’t the balance team but when you have an issue with the game riot support sends you here. So am I just to assume that riot just doesn’t care about the player base? Cause support says dev team is on here and you say they aren’t

> [{quoted}](name=nonstart,realm=NA,application-id=6WpmgL9O,discussion-id=PBwVEGNQ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-01-04T10:29:25.410+0000)
>
> So the team on the boards isn’t the balance team but when you have an issue with the game riot support sends you here. So am I just to assume that riot just doesn’t care about the player base? Cause support says dev team is on here and you say they aren’t

I don't think you can lump every single Rioter on the boards as not working on the balance team, and I'm pretty sure some of those rioters check boards pretty regularly. But, not every Rioter works on every project and developers for all sorts of teams are here on the boards, and some aren't. However, not every Rioter views every single board, and not every comment that could be replied to, unfortunately. Gameplay balance devs most likely are not going to be reading the Live Incident Breakdown thread, but they're far more likely to read your comments or threads within gameplay or general discussion. 

Riot support also sends you to a variety of places: The KB articles, boards, sometimes even reddit threads. The entire point is to either fix your problem asap, or shed light on a way to fix it. Game balance questions, we can answer what they know, but anything that may be unknown (Why is scaling on Shaco's Q this or that), or something around balance (too much damage, when nerfing champions as a whole?), is 100% not in support's wheelhouse to solve. Aside from us sending your response to the balance team, we can also send you where they lurk, and hope that they may also directly choose to engage on your question or concern.

why some of my friends get a normal ping and i got a fair ping which is not good but when i check it using the cdm thingy my ping for gaming was okay. is that the cause of your server? or my connection?

> [{quoted}](name=Barry4llen,realm=NA,application-id=6WpmgL9O,discussion-id=PBwVEGNQ,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-01-04T17:34:19.605+0000)
>
> why some of my friends get a normal ping and i got a fair ping which is not good but when i check it using the cdm thingy my ping for gaming was okay. is that the cause of your server? or my connection?

Well, there's this really cool tool we launched a year or two ago here: https://lagreport.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/ (Might wanna check it out).

Short answer, is data going from your computer to a ping server is probably a different route than the data your computer will send to our servers and back again. Depending on time of day (morning, evening, late night, afternoon), type of Internet (Wifi vs. Wired, Dial-up, broadband, satellite, etc), balance issues (usually depends on type of day and traffic congestion), your ping can vary throughout the day from morning to afternoon to evening. You might want to contact support, they'll probably have you run trace routes to our servers when it's unusual vs. when it's normal and see what's up.
